lines.text: They're just gonna keep cranking out that same kind of garbage. Right now the idea is to have me produce fast-buck bubblegum shit. Then when they think the drug supplies are loosening up, then they tell me to produce some music for kids to freak out by.
You mean, like instant social remedies from the same wonderful people who gave us decadence?

Music is my life. It's important to me. It's important to people; I mean, if it's good, it can give people some hope and some relief from all the shit in this world. And it can make them feel good, even if it is only for a couple of minutes. And that's what I wanna do. And I'm gonna do it.
To Janis, baby, wherever you are.
I saw her once. God, what an ugly bitch. On the outside, you know; on the inside, she was beautiful. She was me turned inside... out.
You know, if Miss America over there could only *sing*, right, she'd be a superstar. Doesn't she know her voice comes out of *your* head?

[reading a critic's review]
"Miss Page comes off as a walking, talking Kewpie doll carved out of maple sugar candy; too sweet for my taste." Do you know I did everything but crawl into this little faggot's pants?

You know, Buckmaster, you are what's wrong with America today. You're supposed to be an artist. You're supposed to have soul. But you're just a schemer, like them. When the artists of a nation act like politicians, and businessmen, we can expect the decline of greatness.
We're all going back, folks, to apple pie, and coffee, and home cookin'.
